outputs.name: luminaire
outputs.description: A Honeybee Luminaire that can be used in a recipe.

inputs.name: _ies
inputs.description: Path to an IES LM-63 photometric file or a string of the file contents.

inputs.name: _name_
inputs.description:
Optional name of the luminaire. If None the IES file is used as
the luminaire name. If the Honeybee Model includes multiple luminaires,
each luminaire must have an unique name.

inputs.name: _luminaire_zone
inputs.description:
A Honeybee LuminaireZone. The LuminaireZone specifices
the location and rotation of the luminaire instances.

inputs.name: custom_lamp_
inputs.description:
A Honeybee CustomLamp. This can be used to specify custom
chromaticity, color or color temperature.

inputs.name: _loss_fac_
inputs.description:
A scalar multiplier applied to account for lamp lumen
depreciation, dirt depreciation, or other system losses. Must be
greater than 0 (default: 1).

inputs.name: _cand_mult_
inputs.description:
Additional scalar multiplier applied to candela values
after parsing the IES file. Must be greater than 0 (default: 1).

code:
try:  # import the core honeybee dependencies
    from honeybee.typing import clean_rad_string
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:
    from honeybee_radiance.luminaire import Luminaire, LuminaireZone
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import honeybee_radiance:\n\t{}'.format(e))

try:  # import ladybug_{{cad}} dependencies
    from ladybug_{{cad}}.{{plugin}} import all_required_inputs
except ImportError as e:
    raise ImportError('\nFailed to import ladybug_{{cad}}:\n\t{}'.format(e))


if all_required_inputs(ghenv.Component):
    # set defaults
    display_name = None if _name_ is None else _name_
    identifier = None if _name_ is None else clean_rad_string(display_name)
    light_loss_factor = 1 if _loss_fac_ is None else _loss_fac_
    candela_multiplier = 1 if _cand_mult_ is None else _cand_mult_
    custom_lamp = custom_lamp_ or None

    # create luminaire
    luminaire = Luminaire(
        _ies, identifier=identifier, luminaire_zone=_luminaire_zone, custom_lamp=custom_lamp,
        light_loss_factor=light_loss_factor,candela_multiplier=candela_multiplier)
    if display_name is not None:
        luminaire.display_name = display_name
name: HB Luminaire
description:
Create a Honeybee Luminaire.
_
The Luminaire object stores the photometric data of a light fixture and
provides methods to:
    - Parse IES LM-63 photometric data
    - Generate Radiance geometry via ies2rad
    - Generate photometric web geometry
    - Place and orient luminaire instances in space via a LuminaireZone
_
The Luminaire must be added to the Honeybee Model. The translation through ies2rad
happens in the recipe.
-
